at line 55
static string format(int|float|string $value, int|null $precision = null, string $locale = '')

Localize a number representation (for instance, converts 1234.5 to '1,234.5' in case of English and to '1.234,5' in case of Italian).

Parameters

int|float|string $value The string value to convert
int|null $precision The wanted precision (well use {@link http://php.net/manual/function.round.php})
string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

Return Value

string Returns an empty string $value is not a number, otherwise returns the localized representation of the number

at line 124
static int|float|null unformat(string $value, string $locale = '')

Convert a localized representation of a number to a number (for instance, converts the string '1,234' to 1234 in case of English and to 1.234 in case of Italian).

Parameters

string $value The string value to convert
string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

Return Value

int|float|null Returns null if $value is not valid, the numeric value otherwise
